tool.name: Create folders and check data
tool.description: Generates output folders and checks for data completeness.
tool.command:
create_folders_check_data.py $input_image_path $output_results_path $dir_structure $robo_num $imaging_mode $morphology_channel $px_overlap $wells_toggle $timepoints_toggle $channels_toggle $check_data $outfile
#if $hnum != '': --num_rows '$hnum' #end if #if $vnum != '': --num_cols '$vnum' #end if #if str($these_wells_only) !='': --chosen_wells '$these_wells_only' #end if #if str($these_times_only) !='': --chosen_timepoints '$these_times_only' #end if #if str($these_channels_only) !='': --chosen_channels '$these_channels_only' #end if

param.name: dir_structure
param.label: Select folder stucture of raw images
param.help: Indicate whether input images are saved directly in the input folder (legacy datasets), or are saved under separate folders by well.

param.name: output_results_path
param.label: Enter path to output destination. Must contain the string 'GXYTMP' (case sensitive)

param.name: morphology_channel
param.label: Enter morphology channel identifier
param.help: This should match the characters in filename, e.g. FITC, RFP, GFP16, RFP16

param.name: robo_num
param.label: Select microscope or auto-detect
param.help: Select file naming convention used for imaging. Auto-detect only works if input images are in a RoboXImages folder. For IXM please use Robo 0.

param.name: imaging_mode
param.label: Select imaging modality
param.help: You only need to change this if you are using old Robo4 naming scheme. If you are using the Robo0 option above, this parameter is not used.

param.name: hnum
param.label: Optional: Enter montage image rows
param.help: Leave blank to auto-detect array size, or enter montage image rows (e.g. 4). Must enter a value if array size is not square.

param.name: vnum
param.label: Optional: Enter montage image columns
param.help: Leave blank to auto-detect array size, or enter montage image columns (e.g. 4). Must enter a value if array size is not square.

param.name: these_wells_only
param.label: Optional: Enter wells you would like included or excluded
param.help: Separate individual wells by commas (e.g. A3,B11,D4,D6). Can also indicate a range of wells using a dash (e.g. B11-D2). Leave blank to include all available wells.

param.name: wells_toggle
param.label: Select whether to include or exclude the wells specified above:

param.name: these_times_only
param.label: Optional: Enter timepoints you would like included or excluded
param.help: Separate individual timepoints by commas (e.g. T3,T4,T9,T12). Can also indicate a range of timepoints using a dash (e.g. T5-T10). Leave blank to include all available timepoints.

param.name: timepoints_toggle
param.label: Select whether to include or exclude the timepoints specified above

param.name: these_channels_only
param.label: Optional: Enter channel identifiers you would like included or excluded
param.help: Separate individual channels by commas (e.g. FITC,RFP,DAPI). Leave blank to include all available channels.

param.name: channels_toggle
param.label: Select whether to include or exclude the channels specified above

param.name: check_data
param.label: Check for wells with missing data?
param.help: Option to check data for wells with missing timepoints, channels, or panels. Currently only works if input is raw images. Will only check wells/timepoints selected for analysis. If any wells have incomplete data, Galaxy run will error out and save info on the problem wells as a csv to the above output path.

tool.help: Takes input directory - where raw data is stored on the server. Takes output directory - where the output will be stored. Takes experiment name - a folder will be generated with the name of the experiment in the output directory. All of the results will be in this folder. Takes morphology channel (as defined in filename). Takes imaging path (epi or confocal). Takes horizontal and vertical dimensions of panels to be montaged. Takes overlap between images that should be used in stitching.
